list_definition.definition: (of) a type of wood, usually black and almost as heavy and hard as stone

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: an African mask carved from ebony

list_ex_of_english: Trials have indicated that ebony and other endemic species can contribute towards this.
The fingerboard is made from ebony and has 22 frets.
They exploited the valuable resources of the island—at that time consisting largely of ebony—but they did not do much else.
The floor is the finest parquetry in oak, walnut and ebony.
They are infamous for an ebony and tattered costume, as well as for concealing their identity behind an ashen skeletal mask.
Trees include the ebony and other kinds of wood listed, and date-palms also shown in quantity.
Ebony is exceptionally calculating and cunning, and puts her cleverness to good use.
Examples exist of boxwood, ivory or ebony, usually with brass hinges.
